definition: to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲

sentences.english: We all started screaming, and ran out of there fast.
sentences.chinese: 我們全部開始尖叫，並迅速撤離。

sentences.english: Early withdrawl of mechanical ventilation led to an optimal recovery in hemodynamics.
sentences.chinese: 早期撤離呼吸機有助於術後血流動力學的恢復。

sentences.english: The British had departed New York, and the general bade farewell to his men.
sentences.chinese: 當時，英軍已撤離紐約，將軍也與部下道別。

sentences.english: And even if they withdraw from its platform, Apple seems not to care.
sentences.chinese: 即使他們撤離蘋果這個平臺，蘋果也似乎毫不在乎。

sentences.english: Fifty-three thousand people—more than half the city's population—have been ordered or encouraged to evacuate.
sentences.chinese: 一半以上居住在城市裏的人們被命令撤離。

sentences.english: The evacuation plans came against a background of mounting concern over the possibility of a nuclear catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 這份撤離方案出臺自對核災難威脅逐步增大的考慮下。

sentences.english: The army retreated from the ruined fortress .
sentences.chinese: 軍隊撤離了倒毀的堡壘。

sentences.english: For aeromedical evacuations, it can carry 74 litter patients and two medical attendants.
sentences.chinese: 在撤離傷員時，可以搭載74名患者和2名醫生。

sentences.english: Good move on vacating scene of unknown substance in tank.
sentences.chinese: 在不知道箱內有什麼東西時，撤離現場是正確的。

sentences.english: Officials in Ofunato, a city in Iwate, advised residents to evacuate.
sentences.chinese: 巖手縣的大船渡市政府目前已建議居民撤離。

sentences.english: Residents in the oil city of Poza Rica fled their homes as the water rose.
sentences.chinese: 石油城波查裏卡的居民在河水上漲時撤離該地區。

sentences.english: All non-EOD (explosive ordnance disposal) personnel must evacuate immediately.
sentences.chinese: 所有非排彈人員立刻撤離。

sentences.english: The British Embassy arranged for me to leave Japan as soon as promised.
sentences.chinese: 英國駐日大使館應承儘快安排我撤離日本。

sentences.english: Why was theteacher climbing down before the students were all evacuated?
sentences.chinese: 在學生沒有全部撤離之前，老師爲什麼要爬下去？

sentences.english: Owing to the danger of air raids, all civilians must vacate from the city.
sentences.chinese: 由於空襲的危險，所有老百姓均須撤離市區。

sentences.english: During the evacuation from Hoth, Threepio and Artoo were separated.
sentences.chinese: 在從霍斯撤離的時候，3PO和R2分開了。

definition: (of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to cut short/to break off/to discontinue/to interrupt
to meet a contingency/to adapt oneself to changes
to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
to utilize/to put sth to use
to handle/to take care of/to punish
